column1: All images come from https://matematyka.wiki/
column3: The matematyka.wiki portal is a comprehensive source of mathematical knowledge, aimed at students at all levels of education, as well as all mathematics enthusiasts. The service offers a rich set of educational materials, from basic topics to more advanced subjects, providing users with constant access to current and reliably prepared content.

column1: Name the types of angles and give their measures.
column2:
Fundamental types:
* Zero angle (0°)
* Acute angle (0° - 90°)
* Right angle (90°)
* Obtuse angle (90° - 180°)
* Straight angle (180°)
* Full angle (360°)
Additionally:
* Convex angle (0° - 180°)
* Reflex angle (180° - 360°)
column3:

column1: Acute, obtuse, right, straight and full angles
What does an acute angle look like and what is its range?
What does an obtuse angle look like and what is its range?
What does a right angle look like and what is its range?
What does a straight angle look like and what is its range?
What does a full angle look like and what is its range?
What tools do we use to measure angles?
column2:
* Protractor: The most popular tool for measuring angles in degrees.
* Set square: Useful for quickly recognizing angles of 30°, 45°, 60° and 90°.
* Compass: Can be used to transfer and compare angles.

Reflex and convex angles
What is an angle measuring 210° called?
What is the main difference in appearance between a convex and reflex angle?
column2: A convex angle is the "smaller part" of a circle (up to 180°), while a reflex angle is the "larger part" of a circle (above 180°).

column1: What is the range of measures for a reflex angle?
Give an example of a reflex angle measure.
column2: Any measure greater than 180° and less than 360°, for example 200°, 270°, 350°.

column1: An angle measures 181°. What type of angle is it?
What is the smallest reflex angle?
column2: An angle measuring minimally more than 180°, e.g. 180.001°.

column1: What common name (convex or reflex) will we give to angles measuring 15°, 90°, 175°?
Which angles are classified as convex angles?
column2:
All angles with a measure less than or equal to 180°:
* acute angle
* right angle
* obtuse angle
* straight angle

column1: Is a right angle a convex angle?
column2: Yes, because its measure (90°) is less than 180°.

column1: Is a straight angle a convex angle?
column2: Yes, the definition of a convex angle includes angles measuring up to and including 180°.

column1: True or false: Every acute and obtuse angle is simultaneously a convex angle.
What is the largest convex angle?
Is a full angle a reflex angle?
column2:
No.
A reflex angle is an angle with a measure greater than 180° and less than 360°.
